p: Consequently, renewed interest has been placed on the discovery and use of natural bioactive resources in medicinal plants to control diseases, food spoilage microorganisms and oxidation [ 6– 11]. Such medicinal plants include ornamental and horticultural crops that contain essential oils that are bioactive against the development of certain microorganisms [ 12– 15]. The essential oils with high content of phenolics are recognized as strong antioxidants [ 16– 20] and have antimicrobial activities against different types of microorganisms [ 21– 27].
